class_notes: In this freshman seminar we will learn to listen and engage with a range of contemporary accounts about the connections between Life, Land & Place. We will do close readings of ethnographic, philosophical, fiction, and non-fiction works by scholars, writers, artists, and knowledge producers from a range of cultures, nations, and locations (including Dakota, Italy, Mohawk, Muscogee, Seneca, U.S, and Western Apache). Our main themes are people's lives in relation to land, non-human species, the natural environment, care, and ethics.
course_description: Seminar on various anthropological topics. Satisfies general education Freshman Seminar.
schedule_location: TTh 1pm-2:15pm in New Psyc Bldg 225 (36 Eagle Ro
